title: 109_s3511
content: The "Mark-to-Market Extension Act of 2006" includes sections on short title, purposes, definitions, extension of Mark-to-Market program, exception rents, eligible projects, disaster-damaged projects, nonprofit debt relief, and effective date. The Act aims to continue the progress of previous housing reform acts, expand eligibility for restructuring, and provide for the preservation of affordable housing and rehabilitation of projects damaged by natural disasters. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to include a definition for "disaster-damaged eligible project" as a multifamily housing project located in a designated disaster area after January 1, 2005, with required insurance coverage. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 now includes provisions for disaster-damaged eligible projects, which are multifamily housing projects in designated disaster areas with insurance coverage. Eligible projects can receive funding if damages exceed $5,000 per unit and the owner requests restructuring within 2 years of the damage occurring. Rent levels are not a factor in determining eligibility for assistance. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to extend the Mark-to-Market program to October 1, 2011. Exception rents for disaster-damaged eligible projects are increased from 5 percent to 9 percent. Eligible projects with at-or-below-market rents are also addressed. SEC. 6. OTHERWISE ELIGIBLE PROJECTS WITH AT-OR-BELOW-MARKET RENTS. Amends the Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 to include projects with rents below a specified level if deemed worthy of preservation and cost-effective by the Secretary. Amends the Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 to adjust market rent determinations for disaster-damaged properties and other multifamily housing projects. Additionally, it addresses owner investment for properties damaged by natural disasters. The owner contribution towards rehabilitation for disaster-damaged eligible properties is determined according to paragraph (2)(C). SEC. 8. PERIOD OF ELIGIBILITY FOR NONPROFIT DEBT RELIEF. This section specifies the time frame for a purchaser to acquire a project after the recordation of an affordability agreement. The purchaser must submit an application for modification, assignment, or forgiveness before acquiring the project. SEC. 9. EFFECTIVE DATE. SEC. 9. EFFECTIVE DATE. This Act and its amendments will take effect on the date of enactment or September 30, 2006.
